intro: Canariopsis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy canariopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native habitat.
